column4: I am having a problem getting an external NTFS drive to automount in Hardy.  Gutsy automounted, but Hardy will not.
what have you done so far to figure out what is happening?
dmesg reports 'sdb' when i plug it in, but I cant manually mount because I don't see it in /dev/
sdb is just the device, not the partition, you cannot mount just the device
there is no sdb1, sdb2 to mount either
are there any errors in dmesg?
I know the drive is okay, and ->http://pastebin.com/m3e728ab
it looks like you are getting io errors
did you try any other usb ports to confirm that it is not a problem with the port?
no errors, but it does keep saying [  920.986234] usb 7-3: reset high speed USB device using ehci_hcd and address 7
now I disconnected the drive and got I/O errors again, unable to read partition table.  This isn't cool, I'll see what I can do
any ideas off the top of your head?
I have no idea, it seems like a hardware issue. do you have another computer to test with? even a 7.10 live cd if that worked before
I'll try a live CD, I have some other utils I can try.  It /just/ worked today, newer drive, backed up all my info to it before my upgrade
Well, I turned the drive off for a bit, moved the usb cables a little, and it works now, automount and all.
that scared me.  thanks for letting me think out loud about it ;)
anytime, I am glad that it worked
